title: PC won't turn on at all
solutions: Check power cable connections to both PC and wall outlet
Verify power supply switch is in the ON position
Test with a different power cable
Check if power button is properly connected to motherboard
Try removing and reseating RAM modules
Check for loose motherboard power connectors (24-pin and 8-pin CPU)

title: PC turns on but no display
solutions: Check monitor cable connections (HDMI, DisplayPort, etc.)
Try a different monitor or cable
Ensure monitor is set to correct input source
Reseat graphics card and RAM modules
Try using motherboard video output (if available)
Clear CMOS by removing battery for 30 seconds

title: PC starts but immediately shuts down
solutions: Check CPU power connector (8-pin)
Verify RAM is properly seated and compatible
Check for overheating - ensure CPU cooler is properly mounted
Test with one RAM stick at a time
Check for short circuits - ensure no loose screws in case
Verify power supply wattage is sufficient for your components

title: PC boots to BIOS but not Windows
commonSymptoms: Drive not showing in boot options
solutions: Check if boot drive is detected in BIOS
Make sure SATA or NVMe drive is properly connected
Verify boot priority is set correctly in BIOS
Reconnect or reseat the storage drive
Check for corrupted OS or missing bootloader
Use Windows recovery media to repair startup

title: No boot device found
solutions: Check if the boot drive is recognized in BIOS
Ensure correct boot order (e.g., SSD before USB or CD)
Reconnect the boot drive
Run Startup Repair using a bootable Windows USB
Check for corrupted bootloader (use bootrec /fixboot in CMD)
Check if drive is initialized and partitioned properly

title: PC stuck in reboot loop
commonSymptoms: PC turns on and restarts repeatedly
No time to access BIOS or OS
solutions: Disconnect external devices (USB, drives) and retry
Check for overheating or hardware failure (RAM/CPU/GPU)
Try entering Safe Mode via recovery media
Reset BIOS to default settings
Update or roll back BIOS (if recently changed)
Perform system restore or reinstall OS if corrupted
